content.user_title: Handle Code Reviews with Technical Rigor
content.value_statement: Code reviews often contain unclear or technically questionable feedback that gets implemented without verification. This skill ensures AI evaluates feedback technically before implementation, preventing bugs and maintaining code quality.
actual_capabilities: Verify code review feedback against codebase reality
Ask clarifying questions for unclear feedback
Push back with technical reasoning when appropriate
Implement fixes in proper order with testing
limitations: Cannot execute actual code or tests
Cannot access external review tools directly
May need human partner for architectural decisions

use_cases.title: Process GitHub PR feedback
use_cases.description: Handle pull request comments with technical verification before implementing changes

use_cases.title: Respond to review suggestions
use_cases.description: Evaluate and respond to code review feedback with proper technical analysis

use_cases.title: Maintain code quality standards
use_cases.description: Ensure code changes are technically sound and do not introduce regressions

prompt_templates.title: Basic review response
prompt_templates.prompt: I received this code review feedback: '[feedback]'. Help me understand and verify this before implementing.

prompt_templates.title: Unclear feedback
prompt_templates.prompt: I got feedback on items 1-6. I understand 1,2,3,6 but 4,5 are unclear. How should I proceed?

prompt_templates.title: Technical disagreement
prompt_templates.prompt: The reviewer suggested [change] but I think this might break [functionality]. How do I verify and respond?

prompt_templates.title: External reviewer
prompt_templates.prompt: An external reviewer suggested [change]. I need to verify this fits our codebase before implementing.

output_examples.input: Review says remove this legacy code
output: Check codebase for actual usage patterns
Identify if removal is safe for all platforms
Prioritize fixes by complexity and risk
Check if suggestion breaks existing functionality
Consider YAGNI principle for unused code
Push back with technical reasoning if needed

best_practices: Always verify feedback against actual codebase before implementing
Ask for clarification on any unclear items before proceeding
Test each fix individually to avoid regressions
anti_patterns: Using performative agreement language like great point
Batching multiple fixes without testing each one

faq.question: Why cannot I say thanks or great point
faq.answer: Actions speak louder than words. The code itself shows you understood the feedback. Technical acknowledgment is more valuable than social niceties.

faq.question: What if the reviewer is wrong
faq.answer: Push back with technical reasoning. Reference working code, tests, or documentation that supports your position.

faq.question: How do I handle unclear feedback
faq.answer: Stop implementation and ask for clarification. Partial understanding leads to wrong implementations.

faq.question: Should I always implement external reviewer suggestions
faq.answer: No. Verify they understand your codebase context first. External feedback is suggestions to evaluate, not orders to follow.

faq.question: What if feedback conflicts with my team decisions
faq.answer: Stop and discuss with your team first. Do not implement changes that contradict established architecture.

faq.question: How do I know when to remove versus fix code
faq.answer: Check if the code is actually used. If grep shows no usage, consider removing it rather than fixing it.
